data.name: GameGuru MAX Demo
data.detailed_description:
There's a new FREE TRIAL version of Early Access GameGuru MAX available on Steam now!

This much requested feature allows you to try GameGuru MAX before you buy it and to check your system spec meets the minimum requirements to enable you to run GameGuru MAX. The FREE TRIAL version includes:

* Nine demo games for you to play and enjoy
* Access to all game objects used in the demo
* A preview of all game objects in full 3D so you get a sense of what you will get in the full version

For those who have yet to experience GameGuru MAX, we hope you find the FREE TRIAL version a great insight into this briliant new Early Access game making tool :-)

data.short_description: There's a new FREE TRIAL version of Early Access GameGuru MAX available on Steam now! This much requested feature allows you to try GameGuru MAX before you buy it and to check your system spec meets the minimum requirements to enable you to run GameGuru MAX :-)

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 or newer (64-bit versions only)
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-7400 | AMD Opteron 4274 HE, or better.
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 | AMD Radeon R9 Fury, with 4 GB VRAM, or better
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 30 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Sound Card with latest drivers
  • Additional Notes: Windows-compatible keyboard and mouse
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 or newer (64-bit versions only)
  • Processor: Intel i7-9700K | AMD 3700X, or better.
  • Memory: 32 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2070 | Radeon 5700 XT, with 8 GB VRAM, or better
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 30 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Sound Card with latest drivers
  • Additional Notes: Windows-compatible keyboard and mouse

content_descriptors.notes: This software has depictions of weapons and ammo, which can be placed by the user into the game they make, and those weapons can be used in the game, shooting bullets. When a character is hit, they die using ragdoll physics.
